page.title: 09LOCAL NEWS (2)
page.content: The news this week has been dominated by the invasion of tinkers and their families.They arrived in large numbers in Carlisle and set up camp on a public car park next to carlisle castle.They had all come for a tinker's wedding. But everyone in and around Carlisle is talking about them because of the mess they made and the huge task of clearing up after them.The tinkers say they have nowhere to go and so must use places like the car park. There have been plans for many years to provide permanent gypsy sites either in the old army camp at Houghton or at Kingstown.The site at Hadrian's Camp is in the middle of our Domesday area and naturally everyone is most concerned.It seems no-one wants the travellers near them.
